resources.string: Fine particles: less than 2.5μm in diameter. Particles of this size are drawn deep into the lungs causing irritation.
Coarse dust particles: between 2.5μm and 10μm in diameter. Particles of this size tend to get trapped in the nose, throat, and mouth.
Nitrogen dioxide: Main source are from vehicles so avoid exposure to traffic.
Sulfur dioxide: Most common source is from fossil fuel combustion at power plants.

All pollutants cause respiratory problems such as coughing, colds, flu, and bronchitis. They can also cause more frequent and more intense asthma attacks. Children, pregnant women, elderly, physically active are most vulnerable.
Only show a notification when the pollution level is worse or equal to the specified value.
